p: For a ratio of sweet potato to M. micrantha of 3:1, the number and biomass of M. micrantha seeds were reduced by a factor of more than 100 compared to M. micrantha in monoculture, i.e., 17,632.6 ± 479.8 vs. 171.7 ± 4.3 and 1.772 ± 0.042 g vs. 0.014 ± 0.000 g, respectively (Table 4). The number, biomass, length, set rate, germination rate, and 1000-grain dry weight of M. micrantha seeds were significantly suppressed (P < 0.05) with decreasing proportions of M. micrantha.
